page.title: 14Inside Tattenhoe Church
page.content: The font is a small octagonal shaped vase of stone and it sits on a pedestal. On the right side there are three family pews which were for the families of Tattenhoe Hall, Howe Park and Tattenhoe Bare Farm. On the left there are plain straight backed pews. The church holds 60 people. When we went to the little church we felt that it was a mysterious place. What has happenedto the people who must have once lived by the church? No one knows. History shows that Roman Soldiers stayed in these parts. Services are held in this lonely little church during the summer. Tattenhoe is one parish that the Rector of Newton Lonville looks after. To visit the chuh you must be prepared to make your way up a long rutted track.
